function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Urban expansion encroaches on wildlife habitat, creating WUIs. Human activities in these 'buffer zones' create stress for wild animals, facilitating viral shedding.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease transmission to humans, leading to potential outbreaks of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Collaboration between planners and ecologists to envision urbanization patterns that do not create WUIs, and regulation of activities in buffer zones.","Technologies":"GIS mapping, urban planning software, wildlife tracking technology.","People":"Wildlife, urban residents, and workers in buffer zones.","Owner":"Planners, ecologists, local government."},{"Description":"Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease emergence and pathogen transmission to humans due to limited alternate hosts.","Mitigation":"Conservation efforts to protect biodiversity and prevent further loss of alternate hosts.","Technologies":"Conservation monitoring technology, biodiversity mapping tools.","People":"Wildlife conservation organizations, environmental agencies.","Owner":"Wildlife conservation organizations, environmental agencies."},{"Description":"Animal rearing creates a risk of domesticated animals acting as intermediate hosts for viruses to evolve and infect humans.","Impact":"Increased risk of zoonotic disease transmission as viruses evolve in domesticated animals.","Mitigation":"Improved biosecurity measures in animal rearing facilities to prevent spillover of viruses to humans.","Technologies":"Biosecurity systems, disease surveillance technology, genetic monitoring.","People":"Animal rearing workers, public health authorities.","Owner":"Animal rearing industry, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of universal access to critical infrastructures increases susceptibility to disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher susceptibility to disease transmission due to lack of access to basic deterrents like water and shelter.","Mitigation":"Pointed interventions for equitable housing, infrastructure, and healthcare access to reduce system vulnerability.","Technologies":"GIS mapping for infrastructure planning, community development technology, healthcare access tracking systems.","People":"Marginalized communities, underserved populations.","Owner":"Government, NGOs, community development organizations."},{"Description":"Centralized environmental quality improvement is needed to reduce stresses that exacerbate the impact of shocks.","Impact":"Polluted environments increase the risk of pathogen transmission and sustain disease in the population.","Mitigation":"Better urban design for human health and environmental quality, equitable distribution of environmental resources.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring systems, pollution control technology, urban design software.","People":"Urban residents, environmental justice advocates.","Owner":"Local government, environmental agencies, advocacy groups."}]}
